application_type_full: Outline planning permission: Some matters reserved
description: Construction of basement (981 sqm) for 8 car parking spaces, 1 disabled space and 10 bicycle parking spaces (outline application all matters reserved)
decision_conditions: a.	Applications for approval of Reserved Matters must be made no later than the expiration of three (3) years beginning with the date of this outline planning permission, and;

b.	The development to which the permission relates must be begun no later than the expiration of two (2) years from the final approval of the Reserved Matters, or in the case of approval on different dates, the final approval of the last such matter to be approved.
Reason: To comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| No part of the development shall commence until all of the following reserved matters have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:
A) Appearance;
B) Layout of front forecourt area; and
C) Scale.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved documents and plans.

Reason: To ensure that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied with the details of the proposal as provided for in Article 4 and 5 of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) Order 2010, as this application is in outline form only.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents (including parameter plans) insofar as they will be amended subject to the approved plans and documents necessary to support the reserved matters application(s) required by the various conditions of this permission:  Planning Statement, 20PERI6, 20PERI7, 20PERI7.2, and 20PERI7.3, received 16th of August 2016.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning to ensure that the development is implemented in accordance with the approved plans, which have been, assessed against the Council's Adopted Development Plan.

| A detailed method statement relating to the excavation and construction of the basement extension shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The statement shall include details of:
o Phasing and programming, including likely timing to complete the works
o Removal of earth from the site
o Construction methods
o Site management and access
o Vehicle and machinery specification
o Number / frequency of vehicles / deliveries
o Parking of construction vehicles
o Routeing of vehicles

o Noise and vibration mitigation measures. Information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation            measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1:                    Noise. Air Quality (Dust) Risk Assessment produced in accordance with current guidance The Control of Dust and Emissions during             Construction and Demolition, SPG, GLA, July 2014. A scheme for air pollution.

o Air Quality (Dust) Risk Assessment produced in accordance with current guidance The Control of Dust and Emissions during                     Construction and Demolition, SPG, GLA, July 2014.  A scheme for air pollution.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In the interest of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and Policy 5.18 of the London Plan 2016 (as amended).

| The pedestrian visibility splays to the access ramp shall be provided measuring 1.5 metres x 1.5 metres with no obstruction more than 0.6 metres high for the vehicle access where it meets the back edge of the footway and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the development has no harmful impact on pedestrian safety, in accordance with Ealing Local Variation Policy 6.13 (parking) of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
